projects.name: Fractal Renderer
projects.desc: Fractal renderer written in C++ using the 'chaos game' algorithm to simultaneously render thousands of points.

projects.name: Gaiawalker
projects.desc: 3D Fighter Game created completely with self-made assets and code. Won the 2023 DPCDSB Game-Making Competition.

projects.name: Rouge
projects.desc: Roguelite* dungeon shooter game in a world of procedurally-generated dungeons. Wrote a custom performant tileset renderer to handle thousands of tiles. Written in grade 11.

projects.name: FFF
projects.desc: Fire-Fighter (Fighter). Your goal is to set the entire map ablaze while fighting firefighters.

projects.name: Aero
projects.desc: Python project centered around flying as far as possible while avoiding obstacles. Authored every visual element and animation.

projects.name: Beyond Engine
projects.desc: Hobby Sonic Engine written when I was 12 to emulate SEGA's official Hedgehog Engine. Several assets are tweaked rips from official sonic games.

projects.name: SuppressThePress
projects.desc: Game created in 48 hours for the Ludum Dare 50 game jam. Scored among the top 10% in several categories, created with only self-made assets.

projects.name: customInt
projects.desc: Essentially a variable-width bitset equipped with arithmetic operations.

projects.name: CivilAIzation
projects.desc: Hack The 6ix 2023 winner - Defend, spectate, and support various world-leaders on a dynamic world stage! Negotiate intelligently to eventually achieve world-domination.

projects.name: Storymation
projects.desc: Hack The North winner - Generates event driven animation with character interactions and plotline.

projects.name: ReConstruct
projects.desc: 3D First-Person-Shooter created with self-made assets and code. Won the 2022 DPCDSB Game-Making Competition.

projects.name: Sonic Reverse Engineering
projects.desc: A several day effort at recreating Classic Sonic installments 1:1 using the Sonic Physics guide and loading level data directly from official Sonic Mania binaries.

projects.name: Polyglot
projects.desc: An interactive language learning app. Users can tap on any object to see and hear translations in a chosen language. Adding an item to a dictionary retains it for practice in quizzes.
